intro: Heisteria trinervia, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slight pubescence, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Heisteria trinervia is often cultivated in gardens for its hardiness and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
